summary: Enhanced extraction with multi-fallback patterns for bill_id/session, Maine-specific sponsor formats (Presented by/Cosponsored by), month-name date parsing, improved committee extraction, and aggressive boilerplate removal

bill_id.approach: Multi-fallback: direct pattern → session+LD parsing → bill reference format

session.approach: Multiple pattern sources: bill ID → legislature line → bill reference

sponsors.approach: Enhanced patterns for Presented by/Cosponsored by formats with town parsing

introduced_date.approach: Added month-name pattern (February 16, 2023) as primary pattern

committee.current_status: Inland Fisheries and Wildlife suggested and ordered
committee.approach: Precise word boundary matching with context keyword detection

body_text.target_status: Clean text from 'Be it enacted' onwards
body_text.approach: Boilerplate block removal + aggressive footer/header filtering

test_case: 131-LD-0732.pdf - An Act to Prohibit Off-trail Operation of a Snowmobile
notes: Bill ID and session can be reliably extracted from filename as 131-LD-0732, confirming hybrid metadata approach
Maine bills consistently use 'Presented by' for primary sponsor and 'Cosponsored by' for additional sponsors
Natural language dates (month names) are primary format in Maine legislature documents
Library boilerplate is extensive and significantly impacts text cleanliness
Multiple data sources provide redundancy (filename, legislature line, bill reference format)
